ISH News told you about the Israel and Palestine‚Äôs Hamas group‚Äôs conflict. Here are some updates. In our previous news we told you that the Hamas group has taken several people hostage. People who are killed or taken hostage are not only Israeli nationals but also nationals of other countries. Several countries have announced that their nationals have either been killed, taken hostage or are missing. Thailand said that 18 of its nationals are dead and 11 are missing. The USA said that 22 of its citizens are dead and several others are missing. 10 Nepali nationals have died. Several Germans have been taken hostage. Many people from the Philippines, Austria, Sri Lanka and several other countries are missing. Hamas had warned Israel that if their sites are attacked any further, they will start killing the hostages. However, Hamas has now released a video appearing to show the release of a female captive and two children. Israel has added more flights to help bring home more military about 3,00,000 reserve force members to help its retaliation against the Hamas strikes. A 92 year old army veteran has joined back the Israeli force to fight against Hamas. Hacktivist Groups (hackers groups) are hacking Israeli websites online amid the war, disrupting and defacing websites like the Jerusalem Post. These hackers piggyback on the fighting, either to support their favored side or simply get attention. Already over 3000 people including hundreds of children have died on both sides. Kfar Aza means a Gaza village. It was a small Israeli village kibbutz (community) near the Gaza border. It was a prosperous place with a school, a synagogue and a population of more than 700. Israeli officials and reporters at the scene were left in shock as Hamas terrorists brutally killed at least 40 babies and young children, with some of them being decapitated (beheaded). General Itai Veruv from the Israeli army said, "Mothers, fathers, babies, young families killed in their beds, in the protection room, in the dining room, in their garden. It's not a war, it's not a battlefield. It's a massacre.‚Äù Basic principle of International humanitarian law is that at times of conflict or war, every effort should be made to spare the young. However, for decades, neither Israel nor Hamas has abided by law. The law states that the opposing sides should provide children with ‚Äúthe care and aid they require‚Äù. But neither Israel nor Palestine does that. International Law doesn‚Äôt allow abduction of children by the enemies. However, during the recent attack, it is reported that Hamas has taken several Israeli children hostage and transported into the Gaza Strip alone or with their parents. Israel too earlier had abducted Palestinian children. So both do not follow any of the international laws related to children. In a statement, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu promised: ‚ÄúEvery member of Hamas is a dead man. Hamas is Daesh [ISIS] and we will crush them and destroy them as the world has destroyed Daesh.‚Äù Defence Minister Yoav Gallant added, ‚ÄúWe will wipe Hamas off the face of the Earth.‚Äù Israel has announced an emergency wartime government. The Israeli Prime Minister joined hands with a top political rival to create a wartime Cabinet to oversee the fight to avenge the gruesome attack by Hamas militants. Israel carried out heavy bombardments across the Gaza Strip for the fifth day as more Palestinians lost electricity after Israel put the territory under full siege, barring the entry of fuel, food, water, medicine and more into the territory. Gaza‚Äôs biggest hospital has fuel left only for a couple of days. All of the Gaza Strip's borders are closed, leaving Palestinian civilians with nowhere to escape or seek safety. Like how India has RAW, similarly Israel‚Äôs intelligence agency is called Mossad. It is extremely strong and it is difficult to believe that Mossad failed to stop the attack. However there are contradictory views by experts - One of the views is that It's impossible Mossad failed to stop the attack. Israel just let it happen. Mossad knew what was going to happen but let Hamas make a mistake so that Israel could launch a ferocious attack on it. Mossad was not so ignorant that it did not know about this attack. Israel wanted to invade Palestine, but they had no excuse, Hamas gave them the reason. The other view is that Hamas conducted a years-long campaign to fool Israel into thinking the group did not desire armed conflict and could be pacified with economic incentives to maintain calm. Sources said that as part of its preparations, Hamas had built a mock Israeli community to train for the assault. Israel surely saw them but they were convinced that Hamas wasn‚Äôt keen on getting into a confrontation. The initiative's essence was to involve young people in searching for a solution with a new mentality and from various angles, with the participation of several distinguished young people from various academic backgrounds, and to direct their efforts and ideas towards searching for ways to contribute to achieving peace and preparing research in various disciplines based on realistic experiences and tangible effects. I am pleased with this effort because it not only presented potential solutions, but also inspired young leaders to play a role in improving our world by engaging them in issues of justice, conflict resolution, and peace promotion. This project did, in fact, yield useful recommendations. Redefining the conflict, supporting Palestinian rights, proposing a two-state solution, promoting cultural interaction, and revising school curricula to address historical trauma are among them. We are still making every effort to bring opposing opinions closer together, to propose peaceful solutions, and to strive for peace and justice in our region and around the world...hopefully in the near future.

12 REASONS TO FORGIVE YOUR SPOUSE...üôè 1. Your spouse has apologized. As long as your spouse admits the wrong he/she has done, find it in you to forgive. 2. You too need forgiving. Maybe you have wronged or you will wrong your spouse differently, you are not perfect. It is not about who is more wrong. 3. To build your marriage. You cannot build your marriage to a better future, if you are holding on to past offense. 4. Your spouse will sometimes offend you unwillingly. Because you two are so intertwined, your spouse will sometimes wrong you without wanting to. 5. You forgive others. Don't be so easy to forgive your parents, siblings, friends, children; but the one person you refuse to forgive is your spouse. 6. To address the matter. Forgiving each other lays the right calm and conducive environment for you two to talk about issues and iron things out. It is easier to solve conflict with a diplomatic spouse. 7. To excercise the muscle of apology and forgiveness in your marriage. The more you two learn to apologize and forgive; the better you two become at it and your marriage will be healthier and not distracted by issues. 8. To teach your spouse the value of an apology. When you show your spouse that admiting wrong and working on the issue is a mature and rewarding option, you encourage your spouse to not be driven by ego and tough stance, but to choose the path of owning up and dealing with matters. 9. Because God has forgiven you. We forgive because we have been forgiven. 10. So that we don't lose a good thing. It is not easy to find love. Don't through it all away, ruining what you two have built for years because of a down moment. 11. To love each other deeper. If you are with a mature spouse who truly loves you, he/she will love you even more when you show forgiveness. What a joy to have a spouse who covers your nakedness. 12. To conquer. Couples that have overcome an offense that threatened to tear them apart, many years down the line often look back and say "Wow! Look how far our love has come and how much our love has withstood. You are still the one I love"

These are such painful, devisive times. Personally, I paint to relax, create, and escape from the conflict and politics. I come to this group for encouragement and peace and joy at learning to bring beauty to the paper before me. I realize that I am not the moderator, nor an admin. But I do want to express my heart to my fellow students, people I have never met but have felt rich kinship with. Can I request that this group would be mindful not to post political subjects? It has happened twice in the last two days, and maybe it has been going on all along and I‚Äôve just never seen it here before. I feel my back stiffen and my stress level rise. I look up to see what group I am in, and I‚Äôm dismayed to see that it is this group that has fed my soul so richly. (This is absolutely NOT a critique about the quality of anyone‚Äôs work; that is not a issue at all! It is the creeping in of hard subjects into what I have come to see as a joyful, peaceful haven.) Maybe I need to leave the group. I won‚Äôt be surprised to hear that in the comments. But perhaps there are others who would prefer a peaceful place to learn watercolor skills? Thanks for listening!

Tughrul Bey of Kayi tribe at a very young age worked for Sultan Tughrul Beg of Seljuke Dynasty, he was given different tasks by Sultan Tughrul, among them was appointment as ammbassador in Abbasi Caliphate, Sultan Tughrul was highly impressed by his Tughrul Bey's job and gave a place near Merv, a small place known as Mahan under his govership, Kayi tribe of Tughrul Bey shifted to tht place. Actually Ertughul bey belonged to his lineage, like he was forefather of Ertughul/Osman Bey. After his death in Mahan, his son Temur served Seljuke state and worked as a ambassador in khwarzamshahi state , in his last days he returned to Mahan and died there. Later on his son,Kezel Buga was alo attached to Seljuke state and was given Merv under his governorship by Seljuke Sultan, he was grand father of Suleiman shah/Gunduz Alp. There is a conflict on who was father of Ertughul Bey. There is a very famous historic event.. its quiet long though.. but it was not shown in Dirilis Ertughul probably due to low budget. Kayi tribe under the leadership of Ertughul was on its way to find a place to settle.. but during there journey they stopped to take some rest.. there they found out a war is going on and they helped Seljuke Sultan Allauddin to win war against (conflict wheather they were Mongols or Byzantines). Seljukes were loosing badly but the moment Ertughul Bey along with his Alps jumped into the battlefield it changed the victory in favor of Muslims/Seljukes. Another example of how good relations they had. Thank you for readingü•∞

Good morning and God bless üôè October 13, 1917 was the last Marian apparition at Fatima. This year marks the 106TH Anniversary of the Miracle of the Sun, promised by the Blessed Mother, that over 70,000 witnessed. This included atheists, socialists, representatives of the Portuguese media, as well as others who despised the Catholic Church. The sun actually appeared to be dancing, twirling in the sky. Then it seemed to hurdle towards the earth, terrifying people. It had rained heavily before Our Lady‚Äôs apparition. The roads were muddy; the grounds were drenched. After the miracle of the sun stopped, the clothes of those who were there dried instantly. The muddy ground quickly hardened and became dry, as if it had not rained in weeks. The miracle of the sun proved that the Marian apparitions were real and God is still relevant in the world. The message of Our Lady at Fatima is prayer and reparation. Our Lady had said that the world had turned against her Son, the world had been distracted, the world was on a wrong course. She was calling the faithful to come back and make reparation, to make sacrifices, do penances and pray the Holy Rosary. Our Mother came to Fatima to implore us to pray the Rosary, wear the Scapular, make the Five First Saturdays. Consequently, it wasn‚Äôt heeded and we still see a lot of evil in the world, even after the Consecration to the Immaculate Heart of Mary that was led by Pope Francis in 2021. Have you been praying the Holy Rosary daily for: ~ peace, to stop the killings, violence and unrest in the world ~ the conversion of sinners Please add these intentions, which are critical now: ~ the traditional family and the protection of children ~ all those who are participating in the Synod at the Vatican this month ~ for peace in Israel and peace in Palestine, as Pope Francis has called for an end to the conflict. We have to pray with conviction and faith that when we say those Hail Mary‚Äôs to the Blessed Mother that God is going to intervene. Never become discouraged. There‚Äôs never anything that is too big, too overwhelming ‚Äì a situation in your family, with your loved one, that is too critical, that the Blessed Mother cannot help. We all have those situations and must have the same confidence when we pray. That is why Our Lady of Fatima is so relevant today. Our Lady came to Fatima to ask us to change our lives. We can begin again! üôèüìøüåπ

This is one of the greatest lessons we can ever learn. We will all experience pain, sometimes traumatic and life changing pain. That pain will impact our life and mold us but the choice is ours as to HOW it will affect us. Even if the pain feels like it will break you, you can decide how you're going to pick up those pieces and put yourself back together. What is this pain teaching you about what you believe about yourself? It is telling you what still needs to heal inside of you and where you need to make changes in your life. Listen to it, feel it and grow from it. Push through that pain to open your heart even more, not to feel more pain, but to defy the cruelty in the world that is trying to replace your love with fear; to not let it break you or change you and to realize how strong you really are so that you can know how much love you are capable of. If we don't, then that pain will become like an illness inside us that will spread to the ones we love, causing them pain, making them suffer and creating a cycle or pattern of pain in their lives too. Pain and conflict comes from inner conflict; what you are agreeing to or believe about yourself in this moment! When you stop agreeing with the story that isn't true about yourself, then you are free to feel the way that you want to feel and live your actual truth: that you are deserving of love. Use your pain to make you grow and evolve to be the best you you've ever been. Transform your pain into love and be a source of healing to yourself and others. -Joel Clemons ‚Ä¢ Love, Life & Relationship Coach @the.gentleman.wolf (I can help you learn how to transform your pain. Zoom & phone sessions available)

The use of a "disappearing map of Israel/Palestine" can contribute to the understanding of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict from different perspectives in several ways: 1. Historical Context: The map provides a visual representation of the changes in territory and borders over time. It helps people understand the historical context of the conflict, including the establishment of Israel in 1948 and subsequent conflicts, and how these events have shaped the current situation. 2. Palestinian Perspective: From the Palestinian perspective, the map underscores their narrative of loss and displacement. It highlights the impact of Israeli settlements, barriers, and occupation on Palestinian land and their ability to establish a sovereign state. It serves as a symbol of their struggle for self-determination and the need to address their grievances. 3. Israeli Perspective: From an Israeli perspective, the map may be seen as oversimplifying or distorting the historical events that led to the creation of Israel. It can lead to a better understanding of their arguments about Israel's legitimacy and its right to exist within recognized borders for security reasons. 4. Negotiation and Resolution: The use of the disappearing map can also emphasize the need for negotiations and a two-state solution. It can highlight the importance of addressing territorial disputes and finding a mutually acceptable resolution that respects the rights and aspirations of both Israelis and Palestinians. While the map serves as a powerful symbolic tool, it is crucial to approach the Israeli-Palestinian conflict with an open mind and consider multiple perspectives to gain a comprehensive understanding of the complex issues involved.

For reasons of privacy, the Embassy again deems it prudent to withhold the identity of the victim unless the next of kin gives it consent. Dehumanization is the negating of a person‚Äôs individual humanity and the cruelty that accompanies it. It is a psychological process of demonizing people, seeing them as less than human not worthy of humane treatment. This method reverses our instincts: harming others goes against our soul-level inclinations as there are very deep inhibitions that prevent us from treating others like sub-human; dehumanization is aimed at subverting those inhibitions. Throughout history, this technique has been deliberately exploited by structures of darkness to distract, sow division, push concealed agendas, increase power and justify acts of violence, slavery, and the violation of basic human rights. When successful, it creates moral exclusion of groups that are targeted based on their identity-e.g., religious beliefs, nationality, gender, race, ethnicity, medical status-and depicted as ‚Äúless than‚Äù, criminal or even evil. The ‚Äúothering‚Äù scheme always starts an ‚Äúus vs them‚Äù dynamic, where innocent people become pawns and victims. As we take sides, lose trust, and get angrier, we not only solidify an idea of other as separate, but also start to lose our ability to listen, communicate, and even practice the slightest of empathy. Language and imagery are crucial for achieving the dehumanizing goal. Once we see people ‚Äúon the other side‚Äù as morally inferior and even dangerous, the conflict is then framed as good vs evil. When this framework has been established, positions become more rigid as we are lead to believe that we must destroy ‚Äúothers‚Äù or be destroyed ourselves. The dehumanizing aim has then been achieved. Now more than ever we need to acknowledge that we‚Äôre all vulnerable to the slow, insidious and manipulative psychological weapon of dehumanization. Only by acknowledging this and searching for compassion and healing within our hearts we can avoid falling into this trap and prevent history from repeating itself in a never ending cycle of darkness. Don‚Äôt stand for division, stand for peace. Division destroys everything in its path, instead stand for love, which when it is true and powerful is unbeatable. Questions? Feedback? I wish you all a blessed Friday!

Malalaman natin mamaya bakit ito tinawag na lupang pangako. ùóîùóªùó¥ ùó∫ùó¥ùóÆ ùóøùó≤ùóπùó∂ùóµùó∂ùòÜùóºùóª ùóªùóÆ ùòÇùó∫ùó∂ùó∂ùóøùóÆùóπ ùó±ùó∂ùòÅùóº: Sa kasalukuyang panahon, tatlong relihiyon ang umiiral sa lugar na ito. 1.ùóúùòÄùóπùóÆùó∫- ito ang relihiyon na sinusunod ng mga Palestinong Muslim na nagmula sa lahi ng kanaan. 2-3. ùóõùòÇùó±ùóÆùó∂ùòÄùó∫ùóº at ùóûùóøùó∂ùòÄùòÅùó∂ùòÜùóÆùóªùó∂ùòÄùó∫ùóº- ito ang relihiyon na sinusunod ng mga hudyo at kristiyano na nagmula sa lahi ng Hebrew. ùó£ùóÆùóªùó∂ùóªùó∂ùòÑùóÆùóπùóÆ ùóªùó¥ ùó∫ùó¥ùóÆ ùó†ùòÇùòÄùóπùó∂ùó∫,ùóûùóøùó∂ùòÄùòÅùó∂ùòÜùóÆùóªùóº,ùóõùòÇùó±ùòÜùóº ùòÄùóÆ ùóπùòÇùó¥ùóÆùóø ùóªùóÆ ùó£ùóÆùóπùó≤ùòÄùòÅùó∂ùóªùó≤(ùòÄùóÆ ùó±ùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùó∫ùóÆùóΩùóÆ ùóªùó∂ùòÅùóº): ùó£ùóÆùóøùóÆ ùòÄùóÆ ùó∫ùó¥ùóÆ ùó†ùòÇùòÄùóπùó∂ùó∫: Ang palestine ay lugar ng mga Palestinong mga Arabo at lugar na ipinangako sa mga tunay na mananampalataya sa angkan ni Israel. Sa lugar na ito matatagpuan ang isa sa banal na lugar sa Islam, ito ang Al-aqsa(Jerusalem) kung saan nandito ang Masjed Al-Alqsa na unang Qiblah(direction of prayer) ng mga Muslim na ipinatayo ni Propeta Solaiman(Solomon). Naniniwala din ang mga Muslim na sa lugar na ito nanatili ang Propeta Muhammad noong pinaakyat siya sa langit o ito ‚Äòyung tinatawag na Isra Wal Mi‚Äôraaj(the Night Journey and Ascension). ùó£ùóÆùóøùóÆ ùòÄùóÆ ùó∫ùó¥ùóÆ ùóõùòÇùó±ùòÜùóº: Ang Palestine ay lugar na ipinangako ng diyos sa mga angkan ni Israel at kabilang rito ang mga hudyo. Sa lugar na ito naghari si Propeta Daud(David) at Solaiman(Solomon). Matatagpuan sa lugar na ito ang Jerusalem kung saan pinaniniwalaan nila na nandito ang templo na ipinatayo ni Haring Solaiman(Solomon). ùó£ùóÆùóøùóÆ ùòÄùóÆ ùó∫ùó¥ùóÆ ùóûùóøùó∂ùòÄùòÅùó∂ùòÜùóÆùóªùóº: Ang Palestine ay ang lugar na ipinangako ng diyos sa mga angkan ni Israel at kabilang rito ang mga kristiyano. Sa lugar na ito ipinanganak,namuhay at nangaral si Propeta ‚ÄòEisa(Hesus). Sa lugar na ito matatagpuan ang Jerusalem kung saan nandito ang simbahan Sepulchre,dito naipako,nailibing at muling nabuhay si ‚ÄòEisa. Sa madaling salita, ang mga taga-sunod ng tatlong relihiyon na umiiral sa Palestine at Israel ay nagmula sa mga kanaan at Hebrew. ùóîùóªùó¥ ùóΩùó∂ùóªùóÆùó¥ùó∫ùòÇùóπùóÆùóª ùóªùó¥ ùóûùóÆùóªùóÆùóÆùóª ùóÆùòÅ ùóõùó≤ùóØùóøùó≤ùòÑ: Ayon sa pag-aaral, nagmula ang lahi ng Kanaan at Hebrew kay Sam na panganay na anak ni Propeta Nuh(Noah). Si Propeta Nuh(Noah) ay may tatlong anak na kasamang nakaligtas sa malaking baha, si Sam(shem),ham(Ham) at Yapeth(Japeth). Sila ang ninuno ng mga tao sa mundo. [Sa ilan pag-aaral ng mga hudyo, ang mga kanaan ay mula sa mga inapo ni Ham at hindi si Sam]. Pinaniniwalaan na si Propeta Ibrahim(Abraham) ang unang namuno sa mga hebrew. Si Propeta Ibrahim(Abraham) ay isang dakilang Propeta sa paniniwala ng mga Muslim,kristiyano at hudyo. Nagkaroon siya ng dalawang anak, si Ishaq(Isaac) sa unang asawa niya na si Sarah at si Ismael(Ishmael) sa ikalawa niyang asawa na si Hajar(Agar). Parehong namana ni Ishaq at Ismael ang pagkapropeta. Nagkaroon ng dalawang anak si Ishaq(isaac), si Esau at Ya‚Äôqoob(Jacob) o kilala din sa palayaw na Israel kung saan siya ang nakamana ng pagkapropeta. Nagkaroon ng 12 na anak si Ya‚Äôqoob. Lahat ng kaniyang mga anak at inapo ay tinatawag na mga ùóïùóÆùóªùòÇ ùóúùòÄùóøùóÆùó≤ùóπ(ùóîùóªùó¥ùó∏ùóÆùóª ùóªùó∂ ùóúùòÄùóøùóÆùó≤ùóπ) ùóº ùó∫ùó¥ùóÆ ùóúùòÄùóøùóÆùó≤ùóπùó∂ùòÅùóÆ. Nagmula sa angkan na ito ang ilan sa mga dakilang Propeta tulad nila Propeta Daud(David),Solaiman(Solomon),Musa(Moses) at ‚ÄòEisa(Hesus) kung saan sakaniya natapos ang pagkapropeta mula sa angkan ni Israel. Sa angkan naman ni Propeta Ismael nagmula si Propeta Muhammad kung saan naniniwala ang mga Muslim na siya ang huling sugo at Propeta. ùó¶ùó∂ùóªùóº ùóÆùóªùó¥ ùó∫ùóÆùòÜ ùó∫ùóÆùòÄ ùó∏ùóÆùóøùóÆùóΩùóÆùòÅùóÆùóª? Ang tanong ngayon, sino ang may karapatan sa lupa ng Palestine at Israel? ICON OF INDUSTRIAL DESIGN, PROFESSOR SUNDAY OGUNDUYILE, BOWS OUT OF SERVICE GLORIOUSLY Men of wit and means in the academia joined family and friends on October 5th and 9th, 2023 at the School of Environmental Technology Special Board of Studies and Valedictory Celebration at the T. I. Francis Auditorium of the Federal University of Technology Akure, FUTA to commemorate the 70th birthday and retirement from service of an academic par excellence and one of the leading lights of Industrial Design in Nigeria, Professor Sunday Roberts Ogunduyile. The event which ushered in a new phase of life for the Professor of Industrial Design also captured the launch of his 426-page book in textile and designs, showcasing his wealth of experience garnered over the years in active service, having served as Head of Industrial Department; two-time Dean, School of Environmental Technology; Managing Director, FUTA Business Development Company; Member, FUTA Governing Council; and Chair, Publications Committee before his appointment as Vice Chancellor, Ondo State University of Science and Technology, now Olusegun Agagu University of Science and Technology, Okitipupa. Extolling his sterling qualities while presenting the new retiree to the gathering, the Dean, School of Environmental Technology, Professor Isaac Aje described Professor Ogunduyile as an epitome of humility, hard work, dedication and selflessness. He recounted his contributions to the formation and development of both the Department of Industrial Design and the School of Environmental Technology. He particularly harped on the brilliance of Professor Ogunduyile which formed a major contribution to the curriculum development of the Department of Industrial Design. This curriculum, according to him is the bedrock on which the Department‚Äôs current curriculum is derived. He further noted that the distinguished Professor of Textile Design has authored and published over 60 Articles in his area of specialization in reputable local and international journals and referred Conference Proceedings. He also explained that Professor Ogunduyile has over 14 creative works and exhibitions and has made significant contributions to books, and successfully mentored many young academics in the Department, in addition to supervising 22 Masters Dissertations and 16 Doctoral theses. Speaking with nostalgia, Professor Aje added that the Celebrant has been a great mentor and an academic father to a number of staff and students in the Department of Industrial Design and the School of Environmental Technology as a whole. He mentioned that the Celebrant is enthusiastic, highly placed and productive academically and morally, in addition to being honest, talented, creative and handy in problem solving and conflict resolution. Describing him as a benchmark to staff and students; as well as a national and international treasure, the Dean said that Professor Ogunduyile is a recipient of many Distinctions and Awards ranging from a Leadership Award by the National Association of Environmental Students to FUTA Governing Council Award for outstanding contributions to the Development of the University, as well as Career Service Award from Ahmadu Bello University Alumni Association (International) and Outstanding Oodua Vice Chancellor of 2021 Award. The Chairman of the occasion, Professor Ahmed Tijani Mora, a former President of the Ahmadu Bello University Alumni Association Worldwide, described Professor Ogunduyile as a unique man who contributed immensely to the academic development of his area of core competence. Reminiscing on their younger days at ABU ,he said Professor Ogunduyile was a man of uncommon doggedness and tenacity of purpose who knew what he wanted and went for it.‚Äú He was employed as a clerical officer at ABU but through dint of hard work and determination and vision he became a lecturer and also got his doctorate from the same University where he started off as a clerical assistant. He is a worthy example for young people. I celebrate him,‚Äù Professor Mora said. The Vice Chancellor, Professor Adenike Oladiji, represented by the Deputy Vice Chancellor, Development, Professor Sunday Oluyamo congratulated the retiring Professor on his successful retirement and for the privilege to be celebrated at 70. She noted with a sense of pride his immense contributions to the development of FUTA and body of knowledge in his area of specialization.‚Äù He is a man of his word and committed to social responsibility within his work and living communities. We pray for God‚Äôs grace and health in the coming years and wish the celebrant a happy retirement,‚Äù the Vice Chancellor stated. Delivering the Valedictory Lecture on the topic ‚ÄúEducation and National Development‚Äù, the Vice Chancellor, Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba Akoko, Professor Olugbenga Ige who was represented by the Deputy Vice Chancellor, Academic, Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba-Akoko, Professor Olusegun Akinwumi reiterated that (truncated)

Filipina nurse Angeline Aguirre lost her life in Israel while choosing to remain with her elderly patient during an attack by gunmen amid the Israel-Hamas conflict. Angeline's remarkable bravery, staying by her patient's side despite the danger, led to her tragic death. She was one of two Filipinos who died during the conflict. Her husband, who had recently married her, now awaits her body's return. Erlinda, Angeline's mother, shared her anguish, hoping for her daughter's swift return. The Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) has provided financial assistance to Angeline's family, along with another OFW who lost their life in the conflict. President Ferdinand Marcos, Jr. expressed condolences and support for the victims' families and affirmed the nation's commitment to peace. The Philippines stands with Israel during these attacks. Gaza has been placed under Alert Level 3, enabling voluntary repatriation for Filipinos in the region. There are 137 Filipinos in Gaza, according to the Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA). Students be snitchin' on each other during group projects. They send complaints to their professors: "Dear Dr. P, a team member, So-and-So, hasn't fulfilled their responsibilities. I've reached out to them like 11teen times and they haven't answered. I don't want my grade to suffer. What should I do?" I ignore these messages and choose not to intervene, and guess what? They almost always end up working it out on their own. Ignoring these messages might seem counterintuitive, but it aligns with promoting accountability and fostering conflict resolution skills among students. Ignoring these emails pushes students to address conflicts amongst themselves. It prompts them to communicate, negotiate, and find solutions independently, skills that are vital in professional settings. In the professional world, individuals are expected to manage team conflicts and disagreements collaboratively. By not intervening, students get a taste of what it's like to resolve issues autonomously, mirroring the expectations of the workplace. When one person does not come through, it impacts the entire group, and I want students to grasp this reality and understand the interconnectedness and interdependence of a group. We rise and fall together. While some argue that it's unfair to hold the entire group accountable for one person's shortcomings, I firmly believe it mirrors the realities of the professional world. In most workplaces, a team's success is a collective effort, and individual actions can impact the entire group and the company's bottom line. Learning this lesson in an academic setting prepares students for the collaborative and interdependent nature of many careers. At the end of the day, as their very busy editor, I don't have to manage those conflicts, nor do I care about the behind-the-scenes drama. All I want is my final product so that I can put out a quality project and keep everybody paid.

Int‚Äôl Women Conference 2023 With Rev. Mrs Karen Nubidga #Day1Evening Pictorial Highlights Special Ministration Guest Speaker : Pastor Zemenjuoh Franka Topic: Women where are Your Accuser's? 1. Where are your accusers? This phrase is reminiscent of the biblical story in John 8:1-11, where Jesus encountered a woman caught in adultery and asked those who accused her to examine their own actions and conscience before passing judgment on her. The message behind this phrase is to encourage self-reflection and humility before judging others. 2. A woman as a seed carrier and finisher: This phrase seems to highlight the role of women in bearing and nurturing life, both physically and metaphorically. It recognizes their capacity to bring forth new ideas, projects, and relationships and to see them through to completion. 3. Silence as a weapon: Exodus 14:4 refers to a situation where the Israelites, pursued by the Egyptian army, were trapped at the Red Sea. God instructed Moses to remain silent and let Him fight on their behalf. The concept of silence as a weapon suggests that sometimes it is more effective to refrain from engaging in conflict or responding to provocation, trusting in a higher power to intervene or resolve the situation. 4. Your pain and weakness turning into a message: This phrase suggests that the challenges and struggles one experiences can ultimately become a source of strength and inspiration for others. It implies that through overcoming personal difficulties, one can share their story and provide hope and encouragement to others facing similar circumstances. 5. Waiting as a stage of punishment: This statement questions the perception that waiting for something, such as a desired outcome or a life partner, should not be seen as a form of punishment. Instead, it encourages a shift in perspective to view waiting as a period of growth, self-discovery, and preparation for what is to come. 6.Fulfillment in life is not solely determined by one's marital status. It implies that regardless of whether one is single or married, true fulfillment comes from personal growth, pursuing passions, cultivating meaningful relationships, and finding purpose and contentment within oneself. 7. Are you ready for marriage? Wanting a perfect gentleman and being perfect yourself: This question prompts self-reflection and challenges the notion of seeking perfection in a partner or oneself. It suggests that rather than focusing on finding someone perfect, it is important to consider personal readiness for a committed relationship and to cultivate qualities like kindness, understanding, and compromise within oneself. #InternationalWomenConference2023 #Day1Evening #TransfigurationTV #RevKarenNubidga #AGMHQ

#VantageIsraelEdition: #Israel has given 1.1 million Gaza residents 24 hours to leave the north of the strip and move down south. Residents have already started moving down south, either in their cars or on foot. This is as Hamas asks them to stay put, slamming the warning from #TelAviv. Palki S Upadhyay tells you how the residents of #Gaza are caught in the middle of this conflict.

An update on the parishioners and priests on pilgrimage in the Holy Land... A group of 32 people from the Catholic Diocese of Lincoln, Archdiocese of Omaha and the Diocese of Des Moines are on pilgrimage in the Holy Land and working to return to the United States following the outbreak of war in the region. Fr. Sean Timmerman of Church of the Holy Spirit in Plattsmouth is one of the leaders of the group. He said they were about 90-percent complete with their tour of the holy sites in the region when the conflict began. ‚ÄúWe were near the Sea of Galilee in Nazareth when the war started,‚Äù Fr. Timmerman said. ‚ÄúSo we were farther away from the conflict and felt safe." The group then returned to Jerusalem where they visited the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. ‚ÄúWe had good guides who we trusted. They said their number one priority was to keep us safe, ‚Äú Fr. Timmerman said. The group eventually was able to travel across the border into Jordan, where they are staying for several days. They have been advised to remain in the hotel today, which they have done. Small groups of them are scheduled on flights out each day over the course of the next five days. Fr. Timmerman said they are doing well considering the circumstances, but they are very much looking forward to getting back home. #HolyLand #pilgrimage #war

NPA, PATAY SA BAKBAKAN SA LACUB, ABRA Gamu, Isabela- Nagwakas sa walang saysay na kamatayan ang isang lalaking kasapi ng Komiteng Larangang Guerilla (KLG) North Abra. Ito ay matapos ang sagupaan sa pagitan ng 77th Infantry Battalion ng 501st Infantry Brigade at ng nabanggit na komunistang terroristang grupo pasado alas-otso ngayong umaga ng October 13, 2023 sa bulubunduking bahagi ng Lacub, Abra. Batay sa inisyal na ulat, nagsagawa ng security operation ang kasundaluhan ng 77IB sa bisinidad ng nabanggit na lugar upang iberipika ang impormasayong isinangguni ng isang concerned citizen ukol sa presensya ng armadong grupo. Tumagal sa limang minuto ang palitan ng putok bago nagsipulasan ang nasa tinatayang limang miyembro ng KLG North Abra. Nasamsam sa pinangyarihan ng labanan ang isang M16 rifle at inaalam pa ang pagkakakilanlan ng nasawing NPA. Samantala, naniniwala ang Abra Provincial Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict (PTF-ELCAC) na ito ay isang patunay na mulat na ang mga mamamayan dahil sa patuloy at kusang pagbibigay ng impormasyon para matunton ang kinaroroonan ng mga natitrirang kasapi ng CPP-NPA. Tagumpay ito ng bawat mamamayan na gising na sa katotohanan at lantarang isinusuka ang komunismo. Kasabay ng walang tigil na pagtugis sa mga natitirang miyembro ng KLG North Abra ay ang tuloy tuloy rin na malawakang panawagan ng mga kasaping ahensya ng Provincial Task Force - ELCAC sa lahat ng mga armadong kasapi ng mga rebelde na bitawan na ang kanilang armas at talikuran na ang armadong pakikibaka para tamasahin ang mga benepisyong naghihintay sa kanila sa ilalim ng mga programang nakapaloob sa Enhanced Comprehensive Local Integration Program (ECLIP).#

We condemn the recent Hamas terrorist attacks on Israel. The brutality and dehumanizing violence is barbaric, grotesque and has genocidal intent. We mourn for those affected and grieve knowing that the devastation caused by these actions will endure for generations to come. Conflict in the Middle East can often be traced to the First World War. Lines were drawn, treaties written, promises were made then and since ‚Äì often without the participation of the very people and lands that they purported to help. A century later, we witness the ongoing suffering of millions of innocent people. The enduring impact of the Great War includes unintended consequences. History is difficult and complex. Often what appears to be a solution to the problem causes others to become more acute. Understanding our history can help us create sustainable solutions that uphold democratic values and honor the worth of all people. We stand with those who work for peace and informed decision-making. At the National WWI Museum and Memorial we seek to provide a forum for discussion and debate about the enduring impact of the Great War. We firmly believe there is no better path to understanding than by learning. Image: An Assyrian Sphinx guards the entrance of the National WWI Museum and Memorial. ‚ÄúMemory‚Äù faces east, shielding its eyes from the horrors of war.

When I am lonely, God is my comfort. When I have nothing, God is my everything. When I am sad and lonely, God is my song and my joy. When I am weak and helpless, God is my strength. Amen.
Sincerely invite you to join our online fellowship, to draw near to God, seek His will, pray to Him, read His Word, nourish and water our dry souls, and receive God's blessings.
Perhaps you are going through a divorce or a marital conflict, feeling pain in your heart, and you want to draw near to God.
Perhaps you see this world as too dark and evil, feeling pessimistic and disappointed, and you want to draw near to God.
Perhaps you have lost loved ones, feeling grief and loneliness, and you want to draw near to God for comfort.
No matter what environment we are in, God knows the sorrow and pain in our hearts.
God says, "When you are weary and when you begin to feel something of the bleak desolation of this world, do not be lost, do not cry. Almighty God, the Watcher, will embrace your arrival at any time. He is keeping watch by your side, waiting for you to turn back around. He is waiting for the day you suddenly recover your memory: when you realize that you came from God, that, at some unknown time you lost your direction, at some unknown time you lost consciousness on the road, and at some unknown time acquired a ‚Äòfather‚Äô; when you realize, furthermore, that the Almighty has always been keeping watch, waiting there a very, very long time for your return. He has been watching with desperate longing, waiting for a response without an answer. His watching and waiting are beyond any price, and they are for the sake of the human heart and the human spirit. Perhaps this watching and waiting are indefinite, and perhaps they are at an end. But you should know exactly where your heart and your spirit are right now.""
After hearing these words from God, do you feel comforted in your heart?

üôè Friday Service @ The Remnant "The Roots of Ishmael and Isaac: An Age-old Conflict" üôè üëâ To Give: www.ToddCoconato.com/give:=:https://toddcoconato.com/give/ üëâ New Book: www.PastorToddBook.com:=:https://toddcoconato.com/book/ üëâ Website: www.PastorTodd.org:=:https://toddcoconato.com/links/ üëâ Church website: www.RRCNashville.org:=:https://www.rrcnashville.org/ The Bible is not just a book of truth, it is also a historical document that contains tales of family, conflict, love, and redemption. Among its true stories is the narrative of Ishmael and Isaac, sons of Abraham, and the age-old conflict that traces its roots back to them. Today, we will unravel this tale and understand its implications for our world. While the Church is distinct from Israel and the covenants were made primarily with Israel, understanding these covenants is essential for grasping the full scope of God's redemptive plan. Recognizing and respecting these covenants allows the Church to have a richer and deeper understanding of its faith and the vastness of God's love and promises.

God we pray for peace in Israel üôèüèº üáÆüá± What does the Bible say about the conflict in Israel?  Jesus said in Matthew 24, ‚ÄúYou will hear of wars and threats of wars, but don‚Äôt panic. Yes, these things must take place, but the end won‚Äôt follow immediately.  Nation will go to war against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.  There will be famines and earthquakes in many parts of the world.  But all this is only the first of the birth pains, with more to come.  Then you will be arrested, persecuted, and killed. You will be hated all over the world because you are my followers.  And many will turn away from me and betray and hate each other.  And many false prophets will appear and will deceive many people.  Sin will be rampant everywhere, and the love of many will grow cold.  But the one who endures to the end will be saved.‚Äù (Matthew 24:6-13)  

The first thing I notice about this passage is the command of ‚Äúdon‚Äôt panic.‚Äù Our job as Christians is to not be caught up with the rest of the world with the spirit of fear. ‚ÄúGod has not given us a spirit of fear and timidity, but of power, love, and self-discipline.‚Äù (2 Tim. 1:7)  The second thing I notice about this passage is Jesus telling us when we hear of ‚Äúwars and rumors of wars‚Äù that ‚Äúthe end won‚Äôt follow immediately.‚Äù We might be living in the end times, but this is not the end of the end according to Jesus.  The third thing I notice here is Jesus‚Äô stern warning against false prophets.  It‚Äôs easy when there is fear and turmoil to cling to words that make us feel good, but they may not necessarily be what the Bible says.  Beware of false teachers, be grounded in the word of God.  This is no time to follow popular opinions.  This is a time to stand on God‚Äôs word.

So what's our assignment as Christians?
Jesus says in Luke 19:13, "Occupy until I come." The end times are not a time to sit on your rapture rug and wait until Jesus comes back. The end times are for a glorious church to rise and to rule and reign with Christ as "kings and priests unto our God." (Rev. 1:6) Now is the time to take our royal authority over the darkness, to push back the darkness, to contend for souls, to go to war with our prayers and spiritual weapons. Jesus is not coming back for a weak bride. Jesus is coming back for a warrior bride. Now is the time to take authority over the darkness and to push back the gates of hell with our prayers.

So when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don't panic. Jesus said this is not the end of the end. Occupy until Christ comes. Push back the gates of hell with your prayers and weapons of warfare. Stand on the word and sound doctrine. And remember your prayers are more powerful than you realize. They can pull down the demonic strongholds in the earth, which in turn changes the physical realm. When we go after the kingdom of hell in prayer, we will begin to see the victory in the physical realm as well. Pray for Israel. Pray for the nations of the world. Pray bold prayers and take authority over the dark powers and demons. Christ gave you that authority. The church is the hope of the world. "Upon this rock I will build my church, and all the powers of hell will not conquer it." (Matt. 16:18)

INTERCONNECTED FOUNDATIONS: EXPLORING THE LINK BETWEEN LITERACY, PEACE, SECURITY, AND COUNTRY STABILITY 2023 National Literacy Conference Cebu City Mga kababayan, ladies and gentlemen, Assalamualaikum. Madayaw ug maayong adlaw kaninyong tanan. Magandang araw sa inyong lahat. Today, I would like to emphasize the crucial role of literacy in unlocking opportunities, empowering individuals, and driving our nation forward. The Department of Education stands at the forefront, paving the way for literacy development in our country through various programs and initiatives. Our goal is to promote functional literacy and ensure that every Filipino possesses the skills and knowledge needed to thrive in today's complex world. Functional literacy goes beyond simply reading and writing. It encompasses the skills necessary to apply this knowledge in real-life situations. It equips individuals with the ability to make informed decisions, communicate effectively, and actively participate in the workforce and society. To enhance functional literacy across all levels of education, the Department of Education has taken significant steps. Let me highlight some of the key initiatives undertaken by DepEd: First, the implementation of the K to 12 Program. This is one of the most notable reforms in our educational system. It provides a holistic and well-rounded education and emphasizes functional literacy through the incorporation of practical life skills, work education, and entrepreneurship in the curriculum. The recent revision of the K to 10 curriculum under the MATATAG Curriculum ensures the development of critical thinking, problem-solving skills, good manners, right conduct, peace education, and other essential skills. This revision acknowledges the evolving demands of the 21st century, where learners must analyze complex issues and adapt to rapidly changing environments. Second, we have the Alternative Learning Systems (ALS) program, which offers education to out-of-school youth and adults. ALS has significantly expanded access to education for those who may have missed formal schooling, providing not only basic literacy skills but also life skills. This program empowers marginalized individuals, promotes social inclusion, and offers them a chance to earn a formal diploma, leading to improved job prospects and increased self-esteem. Third, to ensure that school leaders and teachers are well-equipped to teach functional literacy, the Department of Education invests in teacher training and development programs. We contribute to the professional development of teachers through training programs, workshops, and seminars that enhance their teaching methods and keep them updated with the latest educational trends and approaches. Furthermore, DepEd actively collaborates with various organizations and stakeholders, including non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and the private sector, to promote functional literacy. These partnerships aid in the development of educational materials, access to resources, and the implementation of innovative teaching methods. Through the Literacy Coordinating Council (LCC), the Department of Education strengthens its commitment to work with legislators and local government units (LGUs) to strengthen relevant policies and literacy support structures at the grassroots level. To date, more than 300 Local LCCs have been established by LGUs, ensuring community literacy mapping out in identifying out-of-school children, youth, and adults, and provide relevant literacy program interventions. Recognizing the outstanding efforts of partners and stakeholders in community-based literacy development, the LCC has awarded more than 300 LGUs and NGOs through its National Literacy Awards (NLA) program. Let me highlight an inspiring success story from the NLA winners: the Municipality of Kauswagan in Lanao Del Norte. The LCC recognized their outstanding literacy intervention called the "From Battle Ground to School Ground.‚Äù This program has seen a scaled-up response in skills and literacy in conflict-affected areas, transforming communities into productive zones with sustained peace. It has successfully engaged both Muslim and Christian individuals, young and old, and improved the lives of many. This story exemplifies the contributions of LGUs in improving literacy rates and making a difference in the lives of Filipinos. Moreover, the LCC has developed literacy-related policies, frameworks, standards, and tools based on extensive research and empirical evidence. With the support of the Philippine Normal University, research and development work of the LCC has flourished. The outputs include the National Literacy Framework, standards and monitoring and evaluation tools for exemplary community-based literacy programs, benchmarks for adult literacy competencies, and the National Literacy Information System (NLIS). The NLIS provides a platform for the Council, member agencies, stakeholders, partners, and (truncated)

The Conflict Resolution Time Machine provides a framework to help all members of a family or classroom learn to resolve conflict peacefully. The Time Machine process starts with the steps of calming and wishing well before trying to resolve conflict. Both individuals must be in a calm, integrated Executive State in order to problem-solve and learn. Both parties then learn the assertive language to get their needs met. Finally, they share a connecting activity that shows the relationship is still whole. Learn more and purchase your own Time Machine mat for your home or school here: https://consciousdiscipline.com/product/conflict-resolution-time-machine/

Spain's deputy PM urges Europe to help stop 'massacre' in Gaza‚ÄºÔ∏è Spain‚Äôs deputy Prime Minister, Yolanda Diaz, on Friday called on the international community to put pressure on Israel to avoid ‚Äúa massacre‚Äù in Gaza, Anadolu Agency reports. Her statement came after Israeli forces warned more than 1 million residents in the north of Gaza to move south within 24 hours. The international community cannot look the other way Diaz posted on the social media platform X. The EU must demand that Israel stop the plans that are causing a massacre Diaz is the head of Spain‚Äôs far-left Sumar party, which is a junior partner in Spain‚Äôs acting coalition government. She called on Spain and the EU ‚Äúto urgently mobilise for peace.‚Äù Earlier this week, Spanish Foreign Minister, Jose Manuel Albares, said the entire government condemns Hamas‚Äôs attack on Israel, but agrees that any military response must fall within international law. The UN has warned that Israel‚Äôs order to evacuate the north of Gaza amid constant bombing would be impossible ‚Äúwithout devastating humanitarian consequences.‚Äù Spain is one of the few Western countries that announced it is boosting its aid to Palestine amid the conflict. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt confuse Hamas with the Palestinian people,‚Äù Albares said on Tuesday. ‚ÄúWhat we are going to need in the days to come isn‚Äôt less aid; it‚Äôs more humanitarian aid for Palestinians.‚Äù According to El Pais, Spain‚Äôs Foreign Ministry is also coordinating with other European countries to try to evacuate the estimated 120 Spanish citizens from the besieged Gaza Strip. But, at the moment, officials said it is impossible to enter or leave Gaza. To facilitate evacuations, Spanish authorities told El Pais that they would need permission from Israel, Hamas and likely the collaboration of Egypt. STATEMENT ON ISRAEL CONFLICT FROM THE NATIONAL SHERIFFS‚Äô ASSOCIATION Washington, DC, October 12, 2023 - The National Sheriffs‚Äô Association (NSA) today denounced in the strongest of terms the inhumane, criminal and unprovoked attack against the people and institutions of Israel by the terror group Hamas. Also, NSA is calling for a day of vigilance and honor on Friday October 13, 2023. Casualty reports from Israel demonstrate once again the men and women of law enforcement bore the brunt of the initial attacks from the Hamas attacks in southern-Israel. The police officers carried an imaginable burden responding to an overwhelming force of heavily armed terrorists sworn to kill, torture and kidnap innocent civilians ‚Äì including children. ‚ÄúCowardly terror groups are calling on support of the Hamas by using Friday October 13 as a day of rage and uprising, it is nothing more than overt threat to encourage and foment hatred,‚Äù explained Sheriff Greg Champagne, president of the National Sheriffs‚Äô Association.‚Äù "Once again, we saw the evil face of terror and its reviled intentions. Every Sheriff and the NSA rejects this in no uncertain terms. Instead, we encourage law enforcement of the United States to use tomorrow as a day to stand with law enforcement and against terror of all kinds. Tomorrow, October 13, 2023, should be a day of vigilance, and a nationwide day of honor for those sworn to uphold the law. For those that have a ‚Äòthin-blue-line‚Äô patch, sticker, or insignia we encourage you to wear it tomorrow in honor of those who died protecting Israel and their communities.‚Äù NSA joins in the universal call for civilized nations to stand in honor with these brave officers. It calls upon its members to collaborate with their peers in law enforcement and join together in prayer and promote civil actions of support for the families of the fallen officers of the Israel Police. The NSA honors and recognizes the bravery and heroism of those members of law enforcement, and the innocent civilians who died in the Hamas attacks against Israel.

The crisis in the Middle East has reached a new level of horror. Already there have been thousands of victims, Israeli and Palestinian. The Gaza Strip is under blockade, as it has been since 2007. It is starved of food, water and electricity and being brutally bombarded. Israeli forces are massing on its borders, apparently preparing to invade the territory. As well as bringing terror to the people of Gaza, such an action risks sparking a wider war. The conflict can only be understood in the context of decades of oppression of the Palestinian people. Since the Nakba in 1948 when hundreds of thousands of Palestinians were driven off their land, the Israelis have forced the Palestinian people into smaller and smaller, heavily policed enclaves, regularly attacked by settlers and the Israeli military. There can be no solution to the conflict without freedom and justice for the Palestinians. The British government is one of the world‚Äôs strongest backers of Israel, as we have seen with the deployment of RAF boats to support Israel's offensive. We will continue to campaign in solidarity with the Palestinian people and against our government‚Äôs military and political support for the increasingly aggressive Israeli state. ‚ÄúWhen people are rude, offend/attack/hurt you, they have unhealed trauma, they are full of venom and that venom is pouring out. The important thing is that you don't allow them to poison you too. Answer evil with good, don't answer evil with evil. If you get caught up in a conflict, if you offend/attack/hurt the other person, then you can know that you have already allowed another person to contaminate you. Don't let a man behaving in a toxic way ruin your day. Do not allow a man full of venom to fill you with venom. It can't stop a man from spreading his venom, but you can keep that venom from getting inside you. Guard your heart! No matter how good/generous/polite you are, in life you will have to deal with people who will treat you in a disrespectful/kind-less way, who will hurt you. And each time you will have a choice between filling yourself with venom, acting unbalanced, making a scandal, offending yourself or responding in a balanced way. You have a choice between taking the bait or not. Every time someone offends you, trips you up, attacks you, be aware: "Now I'm being baited. And it's my choice if I bite it or not." Most people take the bait. And most of the time it's the same bait day after day, year after year, but they keep biting. Choose your battles wisely. If you get caught up in any conflict, if you let yourself be challenged by anyone, consuming your energy with things and people that don't matter, you won't have energy for the battles that really matter."~ ~Joel Osteen art: Autumn Skye Morrison

Humanitarian crisis in Gaza worsens as conflict intensifies #Gaza's only power station has stopped working after the fuel needed for generating electricity ran out on Wednesday, Gaza officials said, sparking great concern over the #humanitarian situation in the enclave as the #IsraeliPalestinianConflict rages on. "The humanitarian situation in Gaza was extremely dire before these hostilities; now it will only deteriorate exponentially," United Nations (#UN) Secretary-General #AntonioGuterres warned early this week. INTENSIFIED CONFLICT The Palestinian Islamic Resistance Movement (Hamas) on Saturday launched a surprise attack on southern Israeli towns adjacent to the Gaza Strip, prompting Israel to launch retaliatory strikes on Gaza. Hamas military commander Mohammad Deif said the attack was in response to Israel's blockade of Gaza, its frequent raids on the West Bank over the past year, its storming of the Al-Aqsa Mosque compound -- a site holy to both Muslims and Jews -- Israeli settlers' attacks on Palestinians and the expansion of Israeli settlements. In response to the attack, the Israeli military launched the operation "Swords of Iron," carrying out dozens of airstrikes against Hamas targets in the Gaza Strip. As of Thursday, the death toll of Palestinians from the ongoing Israeli airstrikes has reached 1,500 while about 6,600 Palestinians were wounded by the Israeli army, according to the Health Ministry in Gaza. On the Israeli side, the number of fatalities due to the Hamas attack has reached at least 1,300 and the number of injured in Israel surpassed 3,000, Israel's state-owned Kan TV news reported Thursday. The United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA) said in a statement on Wednesday that 11 of its employees have been killed in the Gaza Strip since Saturday. DIRE HUMANITARIAN SITUATION Shortly after the Hamas attack, Israel enforced "a complete siege" on the Gaza Strip, cutting off the water, electricity and fuel supply to the enclave. Those moves coupled with the ongoing airstrikes have made the already dire humanitarian situation in Gaza even worse. The number of people displaced across Gaza has topped 263,000 with more than 175,000 of them taking shelter in the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA) schools, said the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) on Wednesday. More than 1,000 housing units in Gaza have been destroyed, and some 560 have been severely damaged and rendered uninhabitable. All 13 hospitals and other health facilities in Gaza are only partially operational due to supply shortages and fuel rationing, said the OCHA. The World Food Programme (WFP) has begun distributing food for up to 100,000 internally displaced people in Gaza, who are seeking refuge in UNRWA shelters, with fresh bread and canned food, said Stephane Dujarric, spokesman for the UN Secretary-General. "Civilians must be respected and protected at all times. Civilian infrastructure must never be a target," said Guterres, adding that medical equipment, food, fuel and other humanitarian supplies are desperately needed, along with access for humanitarian personnel. Israel needs to respect international humanitarian law when it comes to defending itself on the ground during the ongoing Palestinian-Israeli conflict, High Representative of the European Union (EU) for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy Josep Borrell has said.

OWNERSHIP OF PROPERTIES BY PRIESTS IN THE CHURCH: UNRAVELLING THE ISSUES BETWEEN REV. FR. PROF . PAUL OBAYI AND THE CHURCH/BISHOP ONAH I took time to watch the over 30-minute live video of Fr. Paul Obayi, narrating his painful ordeal in the hands of the Bishop and the Catholic Diocese of Nsukka. My takeaway from the video is that the good priest, who happens to be a Professor of Communication, taught by the same professors who taught me, seems to be having slight identity crises. This is because I am sure that the highly educated priest professor knows the true and authentic history of the Catholic Church. He must as well have been taught and properly drills on the events that led to the policies and dogmas of the church during his years as a philosophy and theology student. Even if he didn't, I am sure that some postgraduate classes with Prof. Ike. S. Ndolo or Propaganda Formulation and management should have clarified him a bit more. This knowledge acquired over time should have been more than enough to equip Fr. Obayi to understand that a priest of the Catholic Church does not have the right to own properties. Historically, the reason why Priests are not allowed to get married is not to keep them holy, no, it is to preserve the properties of the church so that the wives and children of priests won't grow to start demanding the transfer of the Church's properties to them. Before the year 1123, priests, bishops, and popes were allowed to have wives and children. However, upon their death, their children would take the church to court and reclaim all their father's properties, including church buildings. It became rampant that Catholic priests built churches and parish houses with people's donations and contributions to the church, only for their wives and children to throw the worshippers away and reclaim the church as their father's properties. To solve this problem, Pope Benedict VIII in 1018, formally forbade priestly marriages. About a hundred years later, it was formally adopted by the First Lateran Council of 1123. It would take nearly 300 years before it was fully implemented as most priests kept wives and children unofficially as house helps, since keeping them unofficially guaranteed that they won't take away the properties of the church through Court Litigations. Therefore, it is surprising for a priest who is exposed to such or even greater depth of knowledge to say that he owns any property. According to the Canon and Vatican laws, a priest owns nothing. A priest is as good as a dead man. Anything bought in his name was automatically bought in the name of the Church. Even his clothes and shoes. That's why it is the duty of the church to house him, clothe him, feed him, and provide everything he needs. Also, the church does not approve of a lot of things he does in the Adoration as the church sees them as superstitious acts and the preachings that when you throw powder, you may get favours, all sound heretic to the church. When I was president of the St. Theresa's Cathedral Parish Blockrosary Crusade, I took it upon myself to understand the faith I profess. So, I read about three different accounts of the history of the Catholic Church, some of which their authors include Alan Shrek and Rev. J. Dacruz. I understood in clear terms what the church was all about. So that in 2019/2020 when my understanding of the person and being of God began to conflict with the teachings of the Catholic Church, I voluntarily withdrew from being a practicing Christian, and only identify as a Christian for political reasons. Therefore, Fr. Obayi, whom I believe in all sincerity is more knowledgeable than me, should renounce priesthood peacefully if he has the intention of owning properties that are against the rules of the church. He should accept the treatments he is getting the way the priest governor happily accepted his suspension and the way the other married priest also accepted his suspension. There is no need to whip up sentiments and play on the emotions of people. When an institution you are under stops no longer agrees with your personal convictions, instead of sticking on and having identity crises, it's better to withdraw and actualize your full potential. Both Rev. Prof. Martins Paul Obayi and Most. Rev. Prof. Igwebuike Godfrey Onah are great sons of Nsukka who have brought good things to the diocese and the community. It's important that they continue to do their good works for the zone and not be hindered by Dogma. If the Okunerere Adoration Ministry work is more important for Fr. Paul than his priestly calling, he should tow the way of Fr. Hyacinth Iormem Alia, who believes that rescuing Benue State is more important than his priestly calling at least for the next 8 years. He should step down and focus on the Adoration so he can be free from the Church the way Fr. Alia is now free from the Church. Let there be no seed of discord and let love and peace reign, Amen. > Obetta Ujunwa (truncated)

Calmness in Times of Conflict "If a wise man has an argument with a fool, the fool only rages and laughs, and there is no quiet." ‚ÄìProverbs 29:9 ESV This verse encourages us to keep calm in the face of foolishness. When we encounter someone who is stubborn, ignorant, or even hostile, we should not give in to the temptation to lash out or escalate the situation. Rather, we should approach them with patience, gentleness, and a willingness to listen. We should speak truth with love, and seek to persuade them with reason and evidence, rather than resorting to anger or insults. Of course, this is easier said than done. It can be frustrating and even infuriating to deal with people who seem incapable of seeing reason or acknowledging their own errors. It can be tempting to give up on them altogether, or to simply abandon any hope of having a productive conversation. But as followers of Christ, we are called to a higher standard. We are called to love our neighbors, even our enemies, and to seek their good, even when it is difficult or uncomfortable. So, let us keep in mind the wisdom of Proverbs 29:9, and let us pray for the grace and strength to follow it. May the Lord give us the wisdom to discern truth from error, the patience to bear with those who are foolish, and the courage to speak his truth in love.

Some misguided, ignorant people continue to believe that murderous incursions such as Hamas' attack on Israel, or its endless bombardment by rockets launched from Gaza, are acts of resistance and fight for liberation of Palestinian people, so that they can have their own country. They're not and Hamas says as much itself. Even ignoring the fact that Gaza has been under self-governance of Hamas for the past 16 years AND is dependent on water and electricity rather generously supplied by Israel, and even if we assume that it is under some unbearable restrictions (largely self-inflicted), the fact is that even Hamas itself specifically claims what its goals are. And that is the destruction of Israel. üî¥ Here are a few quotes from Hamas' own, updated and already toned down charter it released in 2017: "The establishment of ‚ÄúIsrael‚Äù is entirely illegal and contravenes the inalienable rights of the Palestinian people and goes against their will and the will of the Ummah." "There shall be no recognition of the legitimacy of the Zionist entity." "Hamas rejects any alternative to the full and complete liberation of Palestine, from the river to the sea." ------ Few people seem to be aware that the enduring blockade of Gaza by Israel and Egypt stems i.a. from the fact that Hamas, when it was voted into power over Palestinian Territories in 2006, rejected agreements made by previous administrations - that is the signed peace accords and recognition of Israel. It's easy to see that in these circumstances there can be no discussion about a two-state solution, given that the other party doesn't even recognise the other state's existence - or its right to it - and continues to state its goals as complete takeover of all of the lands of Israel, "from the river to the sea". It is also important to stress that it's not just a statement by a radical, extremist group operating on the political margins (like, say, Al-Qaeda or ISIS did) but one of the largest parties in Palestinian Territories, which was voted into power the last time elections took place, and one which would likely win again if a vote was held today. This means that a likely majority of Palestinians do not think Israel should exist at all. In this context the only fight for liberation is one that obliterates Israel - which, obviously, Jews are not going to accept :) So, it isn't about a group of supposedly oppressed people fighting for their right to self-determination but hopeless extremism whose ridiculous aim is to destroy Israel and build a Palestinian state on its ruins. It's pretty clear, then, that Palestinians are not so much oppressed as wannabe oppressors, forever hopeful their moment will come. Now, you may or may not believe that a 2-state solution could somehow end the conflict - that's an entirely separate discussion. But you have to acknowledge that it cannot even be considered if Palestinians themselves think there should only be one state - theirs.

Statement on Israel/Palestine I have no words to describe the hurt and anger we are all feeling whilst seeing innocent civilians being murdered in huge numbers. Every civilian killed - Palestinian or Israeli - is a tragedy that builds new barriers to peace. The loss of life, particularly of children, is unbearable. Civilians should always be protected from conflict and violence, be that in Israel or in Gaza. Hamas terrorists that kill innocent civilians going about their daily lives and take them as hostages are committing war crimes. Any response has to be in line with international law and without collective punishment. The alarming news of 1.1 million Gazans being told to flee, exacerbates the humanitarian crisis. If ever there was a time to understand the importance of establishing peace in the Middle East, this week is a tragic reminder of why we need to play our role. There is a dire need of leadership in the international community to find a political solution to this crisis. A solution which enforces international law, upholds human rights, and ensures a two-state solution in the region, with a viable Palestinian state alongside a secure Israel. The rise of Antisemitism and Islamophobia across the UK is distressing. We must not allow the ongoing situation to bread hate here in the UK. I utterly comdemn all those who target Muslim and Jewish communities. I urge all communities to report hate to the Police to ensure action can be taken. I remain committed to continuing in my efforts in advocating for peace in the region.

Mayor Michael O'Connor and Chief of Police Jason Lando have issued the following statements regarding ongoing violence between Hamas and Israel in the Middle East. From Mayor Michael O‚ÄôConnor ‚ÄúWe are all watching the events taking place in the Middle East and it is easy to become alarmed by rhetoric and normal to feel fear about this global uncertainty. There is no greater priority for me than the safety and security of The City of Frederick and that we remain an inclusive community, unified, where everyone can thrive. I condemn the terrorism that has brought us to this moment and mourn the lives of innocent civilians lost this week. As Mayor, I will continue to monitor these events, working with our police and our law enforcement partners to address rumors that we could see responses in communities in our country to events overseas. I have the fullest confidence in the residents of our City that we will rise above this conflict and come together to support one another as we have always done. Despite this horrific violence, I remain hopeful that peace is possible and can be found.‚Äù From Chief of Police Jason Lando ‚ÄúThe Frederick Police Department is aware of recent statements made calling for action as it relates to the conflict in the Middle East. While FPD has no information regarding specific or credible threats to The City of Frederick, we will continue to closely monitor these events and coordinate with agency partners to share information. FPD will increase patrols in areas of houses of worship. We urge the community to remain vigilant and report any suspicious activity that might be observed so officers can investigate.‚Äù

Mum Bett was one of the first enslaved black American to sue for freedom and win in Massachusetts. As a free woman she took up the name Elizabeth Freeman. She was W.E.B Du Bios great grandmother. Her case served as precedent in the state that brought an end to the practice of slavery in Massachusetts. Freeman's real age was never known, but an estimate on her tombstone puts her age at about 85. She was buried in the Sedgwick family plot in Stockbridge, Massachusetts. She died in 1829. Freeman was among the first enslaved black Americans in Massachusetts to file a "freedom suit" and win in court under the 1780 constitution, with a ruling that slavery was illegal. Her county court case, Brom and Bett v. Ashley, decided in August 1781, was cited as a precedent in the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court appeal review of Quock Walker's "freedom suit". When the state Supreme Court upheld Walker's freedom under the constitution, the ruling was considered to have informally ended slavery in the state. LIFE & TRIAL: Elizabeth Freeman was illiterate and left no written records of her life. Her early history has been pieced together from the writings of contemporaries to whom she told her story or who heard it indirectly, as well as from historical records. Freeman was born into slavery about 1742 at the farm of Pieter Hogeboom in Claverack, New York, where she was given the name Bett. When his daughter Hannah married John Ashley of Sheffield, Massachusetts, Hogeboom gave Bett, then in her early teens, to them. She remained with them until 1781, during which time she married and had a child, Betsy. Her husband (name unknown, marriage unrecorded) never returned from service in the Revolutionary War. Throughout her life, Bett exhibited a strong spirit and sense of self. She came into conflict with Hannah Ashley, who was raised in the strict Dutch culture of the New York colony. In 1780, Bett prevented Hannah from striking her daughter Betsy with a heated shovel, but Elizabeth shielded her daughter and received a deep wound in her arm. As the wound healed, Bett left it uncovered as evidence of her harsh treatment. Soon after the Revolutionary War, Freeman heard the constitution read at Sheffield and these words: ‚Äú All men are born free and equal, and have certain natural, essential, and unalienable rights; among which may be reckoned the right of enjoying and defending their lives and liberties; that of acquiring, possessing, and protecting property; in fine, that of seeking and obtaining their safety and happiness." ‚ÄîMassachusetts Constitution, Article 1. Bett sought the counsel of Theodore Sedgwick, a young abolition-minded lawyer, to help her sue for freedom in court. Sedgwick willingly accepted her case. He enlisted the aid of Tapping Reeve, the founder of America's first law school, located at Litchfield, Connecticut. The case of Brom and Bett vs. Ashley was heard in August 1781 before the County Court of Common Pleas in Great Barrington. Sedgwick and Reeve asserted that the constitutional provision that "all men are born free and equal" effectively abolished slavery in the state. When the jury ruled in Bett's favor, she became the first African-American woman to be set free under the Massachusetts state constitution. The court assessed damages of thirty shillings and awarded her compensation for their labor. After the ruling, Bett took the names Elizabeth Freeman. LEGACY: The decision in the case of Elizabeth Freeman was cited as precedent when the State Supreme Judicial Court heard the appeal of Quock Walker v. Jennison. Walker's freedom was upheld. These cases set the legal precedents that ended slavery in Massachusetts. Vermont had already abolished it explicitly in its constitution. üñãÔ∏èif you love our content, please consider supporting our page on AfricanArchives.Support (follow the ko-fi page too for weekly posts roundup)
